item.title: TechCommNZ 2024: Thank God, You're Here
item.description:
In this talk, I talked about:

Feedback

Some of the feedback I received from the audience was:

  • Really got me thinking about how I can work to raise the profile of technical writing, rather than waiting for someone else to do it.

item.title: Embrace Discomfort and Challenge the Status Quo for Advocacy and Visibility
item.description:
I chatted with the host of Inside TechComm about:

  • What does the technical communication landscape look like in Australia?
  • What is a technical writer advocate?
  • How I perform my own tech comm retrospective to elevate his role and make it visible?
  • What is the Amazon narrative, and how can someone use this narrative before starting a project?
  • What are some strategies to raise the profile of a tech writer at a company and beyond?

item.title: Product marketing blogs
item.description:
Context

Providing Redocly customers with a monthly update on new features been rolled out across its products.

Problem

When I started at Redocly, a lot of customers were sometimes unaware of various features been rolled out across our products. The only way they could find this out was by contacting technical support.

It was essential to let customers know frequently what we were working on and how it would enhance their developer experience.
